meanings.definition: A complete list of items such as property, goods in stock, or the contents of a building.
meanings.sent1: I need to check the inventory to see how many pencils we have left.
meanings.sent2: The store manager conducted an inventory to track all the products.
meanings.sent3: The inventory of toys in the store was so long, it felt like reading a never-ending story.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an inventory of memories, each neatly categorized and stored.
meanings.sent5: The inventory of books in the library was so vast, it seemed to stretch on forever.

meanings.definition: The act of making an inventory.
meanings.sent1: The inventory of the warehouse was a tedious task that took days to complete.
meanings.sent2: She was responsible for the inventory of the office supplies every month.
meanings.sent3: The inventory of the kitchen cabinets turned into a game of hide-and-seek with the missing items.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts raced like an inventory, quickly cataloging all the possible outcomes.
meanings.sent5: The inventory of the classroom after the school year ended revealed many forgotten treasures.
